greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-digit base-10 palindromes (A002113) that cannot be written as the sum of two positive base-10 palindromes.
example: a(1) = 2, because 0 and 1 are not sums of two positive 1-digit integers, all of which are palindromes. a(3) = 8, because the 8 3-digit palindromes 111, 131, 141, 151, 161, 171, 181, and 191 (A213879(2) ... A213879(9)) cannot be written as sum of two nonzero palindromes.
program: (PARI) \\ calculates a(2)...a(8) using _M. F. Hasler_'s functions in A002113
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Sep 23 2018
